summary: This document is a series of blog posts from 'The Money Shot Blog' written by a Wall Street worker in 2006-2007. The posts discuss the blogger's personal life, pornography blogging, and contain multiple references to Jeffrey Epstein, his parties, and the media coverage of his case. The blogger expresses admiration for Epstein and describes attending a party with Nobel Prize winners and young women.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of blog discussion / Financial figure
persons.context: Referred to repeatedly by the blogger as 'my friend Jeff' and an 'inspiration'; the blog discusses media coverage of allegations against him and describes attending a party at his property.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned in a clarifying statement that he was not present at the described Epstein party.

persons.name: Ron Burkle
persons.context: Mentioned as being mixed up with Epstein in media coverage by Gawker.

persons.name: Sherman McCoy
persons.context: Attributed as the source of a 'sample photoset' linked in the blog post.

persons.name: BunnyBabee
persons.context: A user who posted a comment on the blog expressing a wish to be 'working for Epstein right now'.

connections.description: The blog author refers to Epstein as 'my friend Jeff', expresses admiration, and claims to have attended a party at his property.
Mentioned together in media coverage discussed by the blogger, indicating a public association.
Blogger explicitly states Clinton was NOT at the described Epstein party, indicating public speculation about a connection that the blogger is denying in this instance.

events.title: Epstein Party Description
events.description: The blogger describes attending a party at Jeffrey Epstein's property with Nobel Prize winners, people from a 'Prediction Company', and young European women, culminating in an orgy reminiscent of 'Eyes Wide Shut'.

events.title: Media Coverage of Epstein
events.description: The blog posts discuss and critique media coverage from Jossip, DealBreaker, Gawker, and The Smoking Gun regarding allegations against Jeffrey Epstein, which the blogger considers overblown.

locations: Santa Fe or Galisteo (referenced in a document from The Smoking Gun)
keyFacts: A blogger working on Wall Street in 2006-2007 expressed admiration for Jeffrey Epstein and called him an 'inspiration'.

The blogger claimed to have personally attended a party at Epstein's property featuring Nobel Prize winners, associates from a 'Prediction Company', and young European women, which ended in a large orgy.
The blog post explicitly states that former President Bill Clinton was not present at the described party.
Multiple names of individuals at the party are redacted in the document, including a mathematician and other guests.

The blogger critiques media outlets for their coverage of Epstein and downplays the allegations, while also acknowledging a document from The Smoking Gun that questions the age of women associated with Epstein.
